alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 4:09PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Brief Landspout Tornadoes Possible... At 406 PM MDT, conditions are becoming favorable for the development of landspout tornadoes near the Kit Carson and Cheyenne county line. The public reported a potential landspout that had dissipated in this area. Any landspouts which develop are expected to pose a limited threat. At this time it is uncertain if any additional landspout could form in this area. This landspout threat will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Kit Carson County and north central Cheyenne County Counties in east central Colorado. Landspout tornadoes can form with a developing thunderstorm before rain, hail, and even thunder is observed. Landspout tornadoes are not usually associated with a wall cloud and are often difficult to detect with weather radar. &&
